definition: Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge

sentences.english: Then he sat down next to Voisin and began to write, carefully, without hurry, a thin legible hand.
sentences.chinese: 他不慌不忙，認認真真地寫下一串纖細而清晰的字跡。

sentences.english: Specifically, the clarity and projection of the altissimo range.

sentences.english: I heard Heidi breathe deeply, but she said nothing.
sentences.chinese: 我聽見了海蒂清晰的呼吸聲，但她什麼也沒有說。

sentences.english: Read the word clearly and don't swallow a syllable.

sentences.english: In the guise of a fiction, the truth about himself is articulated.

sentences.english: The enhanced speech signals of the proposed algorithm have better clearness and intelligibility besides higher output SNR.

sentences.english: A regular system (of number-words) also makes arithmetic clearer to understand.
sentences.chinese: 數字的規律系統也讓算術更加清晰易懂。

sentences.english: The depth it reaches before disappearing gives a measure of water clarity.

sentences.english: Typical applications include stream processing of high resolution images for deployed airborne surveillance.

sentences.english: But signs of renewal are evident throughout the city.

definition: clear/distinct/to understand thoroughly/to be clear about
to understand clearly/to be clear about/plain/clear
